MetricDescription:
Average time taken to detect security incidents
Calculation: Total time taken to detect incidents divided by the number of incidents.
Comment: Reducing detection time helps in minimizing the impact of security incidents.
Source: NIST SP 800-61: Computer Security Incident Handling Guide

MetricDescription:
Average time taken to respond to security incidents
Calculation: Total time taken to respond to incidents divided by the number of incidents.
Comment: Quick response times are crucial for containing and mitigating security incidents.

MetricDescription:
Average time taken to resolve security incidents
Calculation: Total time taken to resolve incidents divided by the number of incidents.
Comment: Minimizing resolution time helps in restoring normal operations quickly.
Source: NIST SP 800-61: Computer Security Incident Handling Guide

MetricDescription:
Percentage of security alerts that are false positives
Calculation: (Number of false positive alerts / Total number of alerts) * 100.
Comment: Reducing false positive rate helps in improving the efficiency of the blue team.
Source: ISO/IEC 27002: Code of practice for information security controls

MetricDescription:
Percentage of incidents successfully recovered without data loss
Calculation: (Number of incidents recovered without data loss / Total number of incidents) * 100.
Comment: A high recovery rate indicates effective recovery procedures and resilience.
Source: NIST SP 800-34: Contingency Planning Guide for Federal Information Systems

MetricDescription:
Percentage of employees who have completed security awareness training
Calculation: (Number of trained employees / Total number of employees) * 100.
Comment: Ensuring all employees complete security awareness training helps in reducing human-related security risks.
Source: ENISA: Awareness Raising in Network and Information Security

MetricDescription:
Percentage of attack vectors covered by incident detection systems
Calculation: (Number of covered attack vectors / Total number of known attack vectors) * 100.
Comment: High detection coverage ensures comprehensive monitoring and detection capabilities.

MetricDescription:
Average time taken to contain security incidents
Calculation: Total time taken to contain incidents divided by the number of incidents.
Comment: Reducing the time to contain incidents helps in minimizing the spread and impact of security breaches.
Source: NIST SP 800-61: Computer Security Incident Handling Guide

MetricDescription:
Percentage of incidents that require escalation to higher levels of management
Calculation: (Number of escalated incidents / Total number of incidents) * 100.
Comment: Lower escalation rates indicate effective initial incident handling and resolution.

MetricDescription:
Percentage of incidents followed by a post-incident review
Calculation: (Number of incidents with reviews / Total number of incidents) * 100.
Comment: Conducting post-incident reviews helps in identifying lessons learned and improving future incident handling.
Source: NIST SP 800-61: Computer Security Incident Handling Guide
